I am a postdoc in the Applied Physics department. I am interested in most aspects of theoretical neurobiology, and am currently studying models of complex synapses.

I'm a graduate student in the bioengineering department coadvised by Prof. Surya Ganguli and Prof. Kwabena Boahen. I have worked on a variety of problems since starting graduate school. I'm currently studying how neural dynamics are embedded in their high-dimensional phase space.

I'm a graduate student in the neurosciences program. I study the early visual system, and am currently working on understanding low-level image statistics that our visual system might be tuned to process. I previously graduated from Duke University. You can read more about me at my website.

I'm a graduate student in the Computer Science Department. My research aims to utilize machine learning techniques to better understand how information is processed in the brain, and to use these insights to build more intelligent models that can be applied to large high-dimensional datasets. Find out more on my website.
